bibl.title: For the Aeginetans to Aiakos a Prosodion: An Unnoticed Title at Pindar, Paean 6, 123, and its Significance for the Poem.
bibl.note: To be read together with: Giovan Battista D'ALESSIO, Pindar's Prosodia and the Classification of Pindaric Papyrus Fragments, ibidem, pp. 23-60. - 1. The Problem of Paean 6. - 2. Pindar, Paean 6, Triad 3 was an Aeginetan Prosodion. - 3. Explaining the Double Transmission of Ὀνομακλύτα… - 4. The Status of Ὀνομακλύτα… in the Paeans. - 5. Towards a Conclusion.
bibl.seg: RUTHERFORD Ian, For the Aeginetans to Aiakos a Prosodion: An Unnoticed Title at Pindar, Paean 6, 123, and its Significance for the Poem.

To be read together with: Giovan Battista D'ALESSIO, Pindar's Prosodia and the Classification of Pindaric Papyrus Fragments, ibidem, pp. 23-60. - 1. The Problem of Paean 6. - 2. Pindar, Paean 6, Triad 3 was an Aeginetan Prosodion. - 3. Explaining the Double Transmission of Ὀνομακλύτα… - 4. The Status of Ὀνομακλύτα… in the Paeans. - 5. Towards a Conclusion.
